commit_list.message:
add tags support, plus:

- add .env.local.sample file which can be copied to get a working .env.local which is needed for testing purposes
- pull out some of the hard coded values in the tests into those env variables
- accept api_key and api_secret in client initialization
- default api_key and api_secret to nil so that when making a request the string 'api_key' and 'api_secret' aren't sent to convertkit (this is a problem when you dont need/want to specify api_secret, and that string is sent along anyway)
- there was some mixing of tabs and spaces, i think i caught them all and made them spaces
- bump to 0.0.2
- removed the need to make 2 requests per test (use same response to check success and body)

commit_list.message:
a whole bunch of tweaks!

- add code coverage with istanbul

this exposed a few missing tests, so those have now been added. there's still a few branches that aren't tested according to istanbul, but they are tricky to test and should probably never happen anyway :)

- sadly, drop redux-devtools

unfortunately redux-devtools' strategy for re-running actions/etc just doesn't play well with my fake random stuff (and the general randomness of this app). @@INIT is just called too many times during reloads and commit/revert/etc. ended up not worth it. fake-random is still in place (you can read about my approach to that here: http://ryanfunduk.com/articles/random-redux/) and works pretty well

- a bunch of refactoring

mostly moving things around so that reading the code is simpler. specifically index.jsx is now just setup/bootstrapping and doesn't have the entire App component in it anymore. also change how 'devGame' is used - it's now a lot simpler and easier to follow

- dependency updates

now using node 4 and npm 3. most (all?) dependencies are now the latest versions

commit_list.message:
0.4.0

- Rename Bus `target` option to `container`.
- Add `class` option to Bus and Leg options + declarative style. Fixes #9 and fixes #12
- Lazily load Legs instead of all up front on 'departure'. Fixes #5
- Don't call `stop` internally, trigger the appropriate event. Sort of fixes #14 maybe?
- Bus now inserts a container element (`.tourbus-container`).
- Bus now has `rawData` like legs do, and you can set all options except the callbacks.
- Switch docs examples from using `$(document).ready` to `$(window).load`. Fixes #7
- Use `browserify` to split up the monolithic source into commonjs modules.
- Turn on source map generation, but it's not working yet exactly :/
- Use bower devDependencies for local scrollTo and imagesLoaded
- Specify current version on documentation site.
- Lots of other internal rejiggering and improvements.
- Add CHANGELOG.md for future releases.

commit_list.message: A little more of the code cleanup/formatting done. Mainly, this patch changes the examples to use the googleapi hosted version of jquery and so doesn't rely on the user putting jquery.js into the tree themselves. This is a good compromise because putting jquery into the distribution means it will eventually be out of date, but google will (in theory) keep jquery up to date at all times.

commit_list.message:
Change the data format from [x,y] to {x:x,y:y}. This allows us to do things like {x:x,y:y,delta:d} without having to 'hack' extra data in. This is especially handy for access inside hints. You can use datapoint.whatever for whatever you like. Backwards compatibility is kept with the old data format (it will get normalized inside the library to the new style).

This commit also fixes/changes a couple of the examples to demonstrate/make them work (in the case of deltas, for example).

commit_list.message:
First, rework the deltas thing a bit, define colors using a color: member instead, this lets us have a different look for the delta line and marker depending if the datapoint is above or below the delta marker.

Also, fix drawing of points on the far right side of the graph by pushing the graph in 10 pixels (probably should be less) in the div. As a result we can also stop chopping the marker drawing to the size of the plot area (since we can draw over the edge just like points do).

commit_list.message:
The saturation slider (the right side/fully saturated side) should reflect the color wheel at it's defaults, not it's current settings.

Pratically, this means that setting saturation and brightness to their lowest settings and clicking on the hue wheel should still show the color that _would be there_ at the default (sensible?) settings.

This way the user can see the actual color at that location on the wheel even if the brightness is way down, etc. This is more like what photoshop does, which I think is a good thing.
commit_list.repo_description: Flex 3 Color Wheel

commit_list.message: As part of the cleanup, remove tons of code from ColorMatrix.as. We really don't need all this stuff for applying mutations to the color wheel bitmap data. Infact, most likely the direction here is to entirely remove the need for the ColorMatrix class and incorporate all it's functionality in Wheel.as itself -- meaning that Wheel.as can apply saturation and brightness modifiers to _itself_. This will also limit exposure and code duplication of this work in ColorWheel.mxml.

commit_list.message:
Some refactoring:

- symlink statics into actual directories, don't act like we're just symlinking root items anymore
- refactor getting content paths to use a generic function _getNestedPaths instead of _get{KIND}Paths (now we can support arbitrarily nested directories for all content types (in theory, anyway))
- support resetting info on full site rebuild (so we dont leave deleted posts/pages around, for example)
- rejigger the watching of content stuff so that we call Site#watchContent for each kind separately, skipping layouts and statics which (layouts:) will be watched with custom logic later and (statics:) dont need to be watched because they are symlinked
- attempt to improve error reporting during Site#build, we shouldn't explode when styles/scripts/whatever can't be processed for some reason... still dies sometimes especially with .less files' internal processing (eg, with @import)
